headline.main: THE CAREER OF A SOLDIER; GEN. GRANT'S BATTLES AND VICTORIES IN WAR AND PEACE. THE SAVIOR OF OUR UNION. THE TANNER'S SON, THE ARMY'S LEADER, THE NATATION'S HEAD.A SURVEY OF THE EVENTS OF TWO-THIRDS OF A CENTURY--TELLING A STORY THRILLING TO EVERY PATRIOT, INSTRUCTIVE TO EVERY OBSERVER OF THESE TIMES, AND HELPFUL TO CITIZENS IN EVERY STATION AND OF ALL BELIEFS WHO WISH THEIR COUNTRY WELL--THIS MAN, HUMBLY BORN, TAUGHT ONLY IN THE NATION'S SCHOOL, DONQUERS A PLACE AMONG THE GREATONES OF THE EARTH, RESTORES UNITY TO A DIVIDED PEOPLE, AND DIES A PLAIN AMERICAN CITIZEN, LAMENTED ALIKE BY GRATEFUL COUNTRYMEN, LOYAL COMRADES, AND ADMIRING FOES. EVENTS IN A GREAT CAREER. I. WEST POINT AND MEXICO. AT THE OUTBREAK OF WAR. FORTS HENRY AND DONELSON. SHILOH'S TWO DAYS OF BLOOD. VICKSBURG AND CHATTANOOGA. COMMAND OF ALL THE ARMIES. LEE AND THE WILDERNESS. THE SIEGE OF PETERSBURG. APPOMATTOX. RECONSTRUCTION DAYS. FIRST TERM AS PRESIDENT. THE FIRST CABINET. SAN DOMINGO. KUKLUX TIMES. STEPS FOR CIVIL SERVICE REFORM. RE-ELECTED PRESIDENT. THE TREATY OF

abstract: Career; Illness; Doctors; Memoirs; Religious Experiences as Recalled by Dr. Newman; THE TIMES'S Sketch
snippet: On the 27th of April, 1822, in the village of Point Pleasant, Ohio, 25 miles above Cincinnati on the Ohio River, was born Hiram Ulysses Grant, the eldest of the six children of Jesse R. and Hannah Simpson Grant.
